title: Code Intelligence Audit & Optimization
content:
## Phases

### Phase 1: Data Pipeline Audit (1-2 sessions)
- Automated census of all 30 extractors (symbols/identifiers/types/relationships counts)
- End-to-end pipeline trace for Rust, TypeScript, Python, Go
- Gap analysis (pending relationships, semantic_group, decorators, import graphs)

### Phase 2: Tool Categorization (1 session)
- Bucket A (table-stakes): fast_goto, fast_refs, rename_symbol
- Bucket B (moat): fast_search, get_symbols, trace_call_path, fast_explore, edit_symbol, memory tools
- Bucket C (evaluate): find_logic (remove), edit_lines/fuzzy_replace (keep/kill/consolidate)

### Phase 3: Tool Deep-Dives (~9 sessions, one per tool)
Priority: fast_search → get_symbols → fast_refs → trace_call_path → fast_explore → fast_goto → editing tools → memory tools → manage_workspace
Per-tool checklist: data utilization, output optimization, semantic remnants, code quality, test coverage, dogfood test

### Phase 4: Documentation Cleanup (1-2 sessions)
- Remove all embeddings/HNSW/ONNX/semantic references
- Update CLAUDE.md, handler.rs descriptions, architecture docs

### Cross-cutting
- Tantivy as general-purpose scoring/ranking/resolution resource
- Semantic search remnant cleanup
- Rust code quality improvements
- Agent-first output optimization
